text:
RT @hackneycouncil: ⚠️ The Lea is among the most polluted rivers in London

Swimming there risks infection and diarrhoea, with BBQs and lit…
@PhilipGlanville @metecoban92 @chrismylesk @EnvAgency @jonburkeUK It's an excellent letter, thank you for sending it.
@RossCherrington @SoilsAlliance @EnvAgencySW Yes, accept this is the typical veg scenario, but are you thinking this is not typical or widespread soil problem?

@rsmithsoil @SoilsAlliance @EnvAgencySW Yep but again autumn and winter harvesting convoluted slopes. I am sure there are ways to reduce soil loss but it needs to be understood by growers and financial penalties may be needed to highlight risk

text: @hackneycouncil @EnvAgency Are they still barbecuing swans on the riverbank?
RT @SPSingh35304853: ISO 50001:2018  is a  management system model of continual https://t.co/L0U5I1zfXk know more, join webinar on 4.4.2021…

@rsmithsoil @SoilsAlliance @EnvAgencySW Deep unvaried unstructured destoned soils, high value winter harvested veg based on high field rents mean little room for best practice, and that can happen anywhere but more risky where rainfall is always higher
